meanings.definition: A plant of the daisy family with yellow flowers and deeply lobed leaves.
meanings.sent1: The ragworts in the garden brightened up the whole yard with their yellow blooms.
meanings.sent2: I learned about ragworts in science class; they have pretty yellow flowers.
meanings.sent3: The ragworts in the field were gossiping about the sunflowers next door.
meanings.sent4: The ragworts stood tall like little suns in the meadow, spreading their golden glow.
meanings.sent5: As I walked through the meadow, the ragworts danced in the breeze, their yellow petals shining.

meanings.definition: Any of various plants of the genus Senecio, especially S. jacobaea, having yellow flower heads.
meanings.sent1: The ragworts near the river were a beautiful sight with their bright yellow flowers.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often have to deal with ragworts invading their fields.
meanings.sent3: The ragworts and daisies were having a competition to see who could attract more bees.
meanings.sent4: The ragworts in the garden were like little bursts of sunshine against the green backdrop.
meanings.sent5: The ragworts swayed gently in the breeze, their yellow heads nodding in agreement with the wind.
